title: A short, descriptive name for the model or tool.
creator: The name of the person or organization who created the model or tool.
date: The date when the model or tool was created or published, in DD/MM/YYYY format.
icon: A URL pointing to an icon or image representing the model or tool.
url: A URL pointing to the repository, documentation, or main page of the model or tool.
icaerus_applications: A list of ICAERUS applications this model or tool is relevant for, e.g., 'crop-monitoring'.
uses_cases: A list of use case identifiers (e.g., numbers or codes) that this model or tool applies to.
description: A brief description of the model or tool, its purpose, and its functionality.

content: A list of keywords describing the technical or methodological content, e.g., 'Deep learning', 'Computer vision'.
data_type: A list of data types the model or tool uses as input, e.g., 'RGB images'.
subject: A list of subjects or domains the model or tool is designed for, e.g., 'Vineyards'.
location: A list of locations or regions where the model or tool is applicable or was developed, e.g., 'Spain'.
model_input: A list of input types the model requires, e.g., 'RGB images'.
model_output: A list of output types the model produces, e.g., 'Disease detection', 'Object detection'.
